column1: Service Statement Triad Resourcing offers Design & Development resources on a time and materials, fixed price and outcome-based work packages to central Government departments and the wider public sector. These resources can be provided from our own pool of permanent staff (Triad Consulting & Solutions) or from our extensive associate lists. These resources can be procured as individuals and on a team basis. Why Triad? 20 years of experience in providing resources to Public Sector Ability to procure individuals or teams on a time and materials or fixed price basis Enables you to flexibly resource project and work packages Access to security cleared resources including SC and DV level clearance Service Description Triad Resourcing have supplied time and materials based contract resource to the Public Sector for over 20 years. These resources include both our own permanent staff and associates and covers a wide range of skill sets and experience levels. Via GCloud these resources can also be procured on a fixed price/deliverable basis. Triad Resourcing has particular experience in providing Design and Development resources to Government Development projects. Development environments include Agile (Scrum and DSDM) and Waterfall. Role types include, Junior through to Senior Developers and Designers, DevOps, Scrum Masters, Agile Product Owners, UX & UI Designers, Graphic Designers, Development and Project Managers, Instructional Designers and Learning Designers, Mobile Developers and Designers. Technologies that are covered by our development staff include the Microsoft (up to and including .net v4.5) Oracle and Java stacks and also an extensive list of open source technology. Triad Resourcing has a strong base of associates with these skills who hold current security clearance including up to SC and DV. An ever expanding list of technologies covered includes: .Net Air Ajax Android Angular.js Apache HTTP Server ASP ASP.Net Azure Backbone Big Maps Development Blackberry C# C#.net C++ Cassandra CSS Cucumber/Gherkin – Automated Testing Dojo Drupal Dynamics CRM Ember EPiServer ESTful Web Services Flash Flex Git/GitHub – Source Code Management Google maps API Grails Groovy HTML HTML5 HTML5 Boilerplate (HTML Responsive Frameworks) IIS IOS J2EE JADU Javascript Jenkins – Continuous Integration JPEG JQuery jQuery Mobile JSON LAMP Stack Marklogic Maven – Build Tool MVC4 Framework MySQL Nexus – Code Repository Management Node.js NoSQL – MongoDB, Redis Objective-C OpenLayers Orchard CMS (.NET CMS) OWL PhoneGap PHP PostgreSQL Puppet – Configuration Management Python RDF RESTful Web Services Ruby Ruby On Rails Saas (Syntatically Awesome Stylesheets) Scala Selenium SharePoint SiteCore SonarQube – Code Quality Metrics Sparql SQL SQL Server Titanium Appcelerator Umbracco VB WCF Windows Azure Windows Phone 7 Windows workflow XHTML XML Xquery Zend Framework (PHP Framework) Zurb Foudation (HTML Responsive Frameworks, EPiServer Commerce

column1: Service Statement At Triad we have used Open Source technologies such as ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET Web API, Razor and jQuery to deliver modern web experiences. We have also used Orchard CMS and Umbraco to provide Open Source content management solutions that can be deployed rapidly and support prototyping activities. We have advised Government clients on the use of Open Source as part of their over-arching ICT strategy. We can provide clients with the benefits of our expertise in Open Source software and advise them on how to maximise the advantages of adopting these technologies. As well as the potential cost savings, using Open Source solutions can improve productivity, stimulate innovation and facilitate the collaborative design and development of websites. Why Triad? • Triad’s consultants have hands on experience of delivering Open Source solutions, stretching back over 20 years. • We are completely independent of all software vendors and can advise you on the right Open Source choices for your organisation. • As well as offering you guidance on the benefits of Open Source technologies, we also explain the drawbacks, providing you with a balanced picture. Service Descriptions Our Open Source software consultancy service covers the following areas: • An in-depth review of the technology currently in use within your organisation, focussing on the cost of maintaining and developing existing systems. • An exploration of the likely future trends and directions of the organisation, and the potential role of Open Source technology in achieving your ICT strategy. • Recommendations of the areas where the most benefit can be gained from the introduction of Open Source technology. • The development of a roadmap for the transition from proprietary software to Open Source software, including a review of the skills set of your existing staff against the requirements for Open Source development. Pricing models Triad’s Open Source Software Consultancy services can be purchased on the basis of day rates or as fixed price projects for both individual consultants and consulting teams.

column1:
CookieQ is a hosted service that can helps website publishers manage user consent or permissions across multiple web domains. Customers can configure it so that users are presented with a cookie "opt-in" panel or button and optional reminder banner to website visitors. CookieQ was the original solution released in May 2011 to the requirement for consent to cookies laid out in Regulation 6 of the Privacy and Electronic Communications Regulations 2011. The product has been enhanced with feedback from customers and now offers a complete consent platform capable of meeting any compliance requirements for consent management and communication. See our website at http://cookieq.com

Data used to register consent such as current state, revocation period etc. is stored entirely within the user’s browser and not simply in a domain specific cookie. Action on consent refusal in certain categories such as cookie and local storage removal can be entirely handled by CookieQ, so that no cookie placement is required, or alternatively session cookies can be used to signal consent status to particular web domain servers. Cookies or local storage used “strictly to support a service requested by the user” do not need to be automatically removed.

This platform can be configured either to offer an explicit opt-in mechanism whereby cookies & local storage are removed from their browser if the visitor has not opted in for particular customer defined or standard categories, or as an "implied consent" mechanism where cookies will not be removed by default but visitors can explicitly withdraw their consent whenever they wish. 

The styling and text of buttons and panels is completely configurable by the user, although various pre-baked styles are offered. Customers can design their own panels and banners retaining the look & feel of their website’s branding using standard techniques such as declarative HTML or using JavaScript libraries such as jQuery, or we can design these User Interface elements for them. 

The service can be configured so that a user visiting a website with the W3C standard Do Not Track header signal set in their browser will be given a specific default such as Tracking=no, overriding any implied consent if that is in operation. Analytics services such as Google Analytics are specifically supported whereby they can continue to be used without the need to collect user identifying data or enable it to be sent to a third party not under the jurisdiction of European Data Protection or Privacy law. 

Once consent has been obtained it can be applied across any number of web domains owned by the same data controller. This means that if the Government explains a single privacy and cookie storage policy to a visitor a positive indication of consent will immediately be available to the servers of all its other website domains. 

A "dashboard" feature allows the customer to manage the consent settings on all its websites instantly without needing to take down servers, and only needs to install a single line script snippet on every site. Implicit, explicit or no consent can be controlled by the dashboard or by automatic geo-location based on the visitor's source IP address. 


The CookieQ audit service 

The audit scanner is a cloud resident service that executes a spider scan of a site’s pages in order to generate an exhaustive and detailed  report of 1st party & 3rd party HTTP cookies (both those generated by set-cookies headers and JavaScript), Adobe “flash” cookies, localStorage usage and other site specific information. The report is formatted as an HTML document and emailed to the customer.
